title: sleep-debt-tracker
description: Sleep-debt-tracker is a web application built with TypeScript, JavaScript, CSS, and HTML designed to help users monitor and manage their sleep debt. This project allows users to log their sleep hours and track the accumulated difference between their ideal sleep and actual sleep, providing a visual representation of their sleep debt over time. It leverages TypeScript for type safety and improved code maintainability, offering a practical example of a modern web development project focused on personal health and wellness tracking.

title: jovian
description: Jovian is a CRUD application built with Python (Flask framework), PostgreSQL for database management, and HTML/CSS for the frontend. This project demonstrates a practical implementation of a full-stack web application, covering core concepts of database interactions, server-side logic, and user interface design, making it a valuable learning resource for Python and web development enthusiasts.

title: robofleet-dashboard
description: The robofleet-dashboard repository provides a web-based interface built with JavaScript, Python, HTML, and CSS for visualizing and interacting with data from a Robofleet robotics system. This project offers real-time monitoring, control, and analysis capabilities, facilitating efficient management and operation of robot fleets within the scope of robotics.

title: ros-log-viewer
description: ros-log-viewer is a web-based tool built with JavaScript, Python, HTML, CSS, and Shell scripting for visualizing and analyzing ROS (Robot Operating System) log files. This project provides a user-friendly interface to parse, filter, and display ROS log data, making it easier to debug and understand the behavior of ROS-based systems. The application aims to improve the debugging workflow by offering an intuitive way to browse and interpret log messages.

title: next-voting
description: Next-voting is a web application built with Next.js (TypeScript, JavaScript, CSS) that provides a platform for creating and participating in various voting events. Leveraging modern web development practices, this project aims to offer a user-friendly and efficient solution for simple online voting. The repository encompasses the full-stack development of the application, covering aspects like user authentication, vote submission, and result visualization, making it a practical example for those interested in project-based learning.

title: next-idea-board
description: Next-idea-board is a web application built with TypeScript, CSS, and JavaScript, designed to be a visual and collaborative platform for brainstorming and organizing ideas. This project allows users to create, manage, and prioritize ideas using a drag-and-drop interface, fostering teamwork and streamlined project planning. It leverages modern web development practices to provide a smooth and intuitive user experience for anyone looking to manage their creative process.

title: genietalks
description: GenieTalks is a full-stack project leveraging TypeScript, Vite, and Express.js to build a dynamic web application powered by the Gemini API. This repository showcases a modern approach to integrating AI capabilities into web development, demonstrating best practices in TypeScript, CSS, JavaScript, and HTML while exploring the power of the Gemini API within an Express.js backend.

title: dynamic-event-calendar
description: This project, titled dynamic-event-calendar, is a web-based event calendar built using JavaScript, CSS, and HTML. It focuses on providing a dynamic and interactive user experience for managing and displaying events. The calendar allows users to view events on specific dates and potentially add or edit events through the front-end interface. This repository serves as a project demonstrating front-end development skills and practical application of web technologies.

title: iot-asset-tracking
description: This repository hosts a modern IoT asset tracking web application built with Next.js, TypeScript, Tailwind CSS, and Supabase. The project allows users to monitor and manage their assets in real-time, leveraging Supabase for backend services and data persistence. It serves as a practical example of implementing a full-stack application using these popular technologies within the realm of IoT asset management.

title: devboard
description: Devboard is a Next.js 14 project built with TypeScript, utilizing the Pages Router, Material UI (MUI) for styling, and React Query for efficient data fetching and management. This repository serves as a practical example of a modern web application, showcasing best practices in component development and server-side rendering with a focus on clean architecture and maintainable code using industry-standard technologies like TypeScript and CSS.

title: fruit-seller
